meanings.definition: Of or relating to a monarch.
meanings.sent1: The royal family lived in a grand monarchial palace.
meanings.sent2: The crown jewels were a symbol of their monarchial power.
meanings.sent3: The monarchial robes were so heavy, they made the king trip during the ceremony.
meanings.sent4: Her presence was so monarchial, it commanded respect from all who saw her.
meanings.sent5: The monarchial decree echoed through the halls, shaping the kingdom's future.

meanings.sent1: The monarchial behavior of the queen was admired by all.
meanings.sent2: His monarchial attitude made him a natural leader.
meanings.sent3: The cat's monarchial demeanor made it the ruler of the household.
meanings.sent4: The monarchial grace with which she carried herself was truly regal.
meanings.sent5: The monarchial presence of the lion made all other animals bow in respect.

meanings.sent1: The monarchial procession included all the nobles of the land.
meanings.sent2: The monarchial duties kept the king busy day and night.
meanings.sent3: The monarchial entourage arrived in a grand parade of carriages.
meanings.sent4: The monarchial authority was evident in every decision made by the ruler.
meanings.sent5: The monarchial lineage traced back to the founding king of the realm.
